results.title: Little houses for little people
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David tells us more about the magical world of the gnomes. In “Little houses for little people” he explains the gnomes’ secret and special underground houses. “The wedding that almost wasn’t” - All the Gnomes gather to celebrate a wedding - but the trolls are unwelcome guests! Based on “The gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
David the gnome enters the wonderful world of adventure as he tries to help his fellow creatures out of trouble. This program consists of 2 episodes, ‘Good Medicine’ captures David’s skills as a doctor and ‘Witch Way Out?’ finds David and his faithful fox, Swift, captured by ugly and vicious trolls. Based on the book “The Gnomes” by Rien Poortvliet and Will Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.brief_description: A series of videos each containing two adventures of David the Gnome, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, narrated by Christopher Plummer and animated for the screen from the stories of Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen.

results.title: The World of Watteau
results.brief_description: Looks at the contemporary lifestyle of the French court at the beginning of the eighteenth century through the eyes of the painter Watteau. The refinement and grace of French court life at the beginning of the eighteenth century found its expression in the art of the French painter Antoine Watteau. He captures the rich satins and delicate laces of the courtly costumes, and the play of light, and shade is costumes, and the play of light and shade in the pleasure gardens with a lightness of touch and bold economy of line that foreshadows the Impressionists. But Watteau did more than reflect the surface charm of this world; he sensed the sadness and emptiness of lives spent in endless search of pleasure, a mood that underlines many of his greatest works.

results.title: Good medicine; witch way out
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Ronald A Weinberg, Micheline Charest, BRB International, Miramax Films and Cinar Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of David the Gnome”.
Join David, his wife Lisa and faithful fox, Swift, for two wonderful adventures in the secret and magical world of the gnomes. “Good medicine” tells how David’s skill as a doctor is needed to help a sick animal. In ‘Witch way out” David and Swift are captured by the ugly and vicious trolls. Based on “The gnomes’ by Rien Poortvliet and Wil Huygen. Narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: The World of the unborn. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description: Part 1 of the program explains what happens at the point of conception when the egg and sperm are formed and united. A discussion about DNA and chromosones is also included as well as an examination of the development and changes which occur during puberty. Part 2 examines the development of the fertilised egg as it implants itself in the wall of the uterus and the progression of the embryo to foetus until birth. Also featured are the physiological changes which occur during pregnancy. The photography and computer animation used in the program are outstanding.

results.title: Your friends and neighbors
results.creator_credit: Neil LaBute, Jason Patric, Steve Golin and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Neil Labute’s (“In the company of men”, “Nurse Betty”) second feature is a caustic, bleak study of sexual dysfunction and alienation amongst six casually connected friends and lovers. Labute’s brittle screenplay wanders between one relationship horror show to another as these hapless ‘friends and neighbours’ try to connect with each other through a series of empty sexual encounters and misguided affairs. Terri (Catherine Keener) can’t stand the fact that her husband Jerri (Ben Stiller) makes a lot of noise when they make love. Terri starts an affair with Cheri (Nastassja Kinski), a sensitive art gallery curator who’s neediness and insecurity requires constant validation. Jerri on the other hand finds himself infatuated with Mary (Amy Brenneman), his best friends wife. Mary’s husband Barry (Aaron Eckhart) claims the best sex he has ever had is with himself and is frustrated by his wife’s lack of sex drive. All the while Barry and Jerri’s predatory and narcissistic single friend Cary (Jason Patric) dishes out his own brand of misogynous rough justice with the countless women he sleeps with.
